p: To control the global malaria havoc, preventive and curative measures were initiated in the 1950s to eradicate the disease following the discoveries of the causative parasite, mode of transmission of the parasite, the vector, and antimalaria drugs. Although some successes were chalked by the campaign in wiping out the disease in the temperate regions, it failed in tropical countries and was abandoned in 1969. The disease still lingers on, and infection is on the increase probably due to the emergence of resistance of the parasite to most of the common and affordable drugs such as chloroquine [ 1].
